review: Google has done it again! These guys are definitely one of my favorite tech companies. I admit, the Chromecast wasn't quite what I expected. I assumed it would have an interface more like the Apple TV. Instead it interfaces with your computer or phone, so instead of you using your phone as a remote like you might on the Apple TV, you open your app on your phone, then choose to send it to the chromecast. The chromecast then picks up the stream off the net, so you can close your app and everything and continue to use your phone, even watch other things on it. In that sense it is superior to the Apple TV, it just takes getting used to. I set this up plugged it into a USB port on my TV and that provided enough power for it so I didn't even have to use the included power adapter. It also comes with a kind of floppy HDMI extender so you can plug it into your mounted TV, I was surprised and happy when I found that out.
